zone.line: 5thSpirit As over wide dominions
I sped, like some swift cloud that wings the wide air's wildernesses
That planet-crested Shape swiftly on lightning-braided pinions
Scattering the liquid joy of life from his ambrosial tresses:
His footsteps paved the world with light — but as I past 'twas
fading
And hollow Ruin yawned behind — great Sages bound in madness
And headless patriots & pale youths who perished unupbraiding
Gleamed in the Night I wandered o'er — till thou o King of sadness Turned by thy smile the worst I said to recollected gladness
6.thSpirit
Ah sister , Desolation is a delicate thing
It walks not on the Earth it floats not on the air
But treads with lulling footstep, & fans with silent wing
The tender hopes which in thier hearts the best & gentlest bear
Who
'Till soothed to false repose by the fanning plumes above
And the music-stirring motion of its soft & busy feet,
Dream visions of aerial joy, & call the monster, Love
he
And wake, and find their shadow Pain—as him whom now
we greet
X?
Chorus
Though Ruin now Loves shadow be
Following him, destroyingly
On Death's white & winged steed
Which the fleetest cannot flee—
Trampling down both flower & weed
